verses.verse: By night <S%H3915><s%> on my bed, <S%H4904><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves. <S%H157><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him, <S%H4672><s%> but I didn't find him.

I will get up <S%H6965><s%> now, <S%H5437><s%> and go about the city; <S%H5892><s%> in the streets <S%H7784><s%> and in the squares <S%H7784><s%> I will seek <S%H1245><s%> him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves. <S%H157><s%> I sought <S%H1245><s%> him, <S%H4672><s%> but I didn't find him.
The watchmen <S%H8104><s%> who go about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> me; <S%H7200><s%> "Have you seen him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves? <S%H157><s%>"

I had scarcely <S%H4592><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> from them, <S%H4672><s%> when I found him whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves. <S%H157><s%> I held <S%H270><s%> him, <S%H7503><s%> and would not let him go, until I had brought <S%H935><s%> him into my mother <S%H517><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> into the room <S%H2315><s%> of her who conceived me. <S%H2029><s%>

I adjure <S%H7650><s%> you, <S%H1323><s%> daughters of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> by the roes, <S%H6643><s%> or <S%H176><s%> by the hinds <S%H355><s%> of the field, <S%H7704><s%> that you not stir up, <S%H5782><s%> nor awaken <S%H5782><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> until it so desires. <S%H2654><s%>

Who is this who comes <S%H5927><s%> up from the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> like pillars <S%H8490><s%> of smoke, <S%H6227><s%> perfumed <S%H6999><s%> with myrrh <S%H4753><s%> and frankincense, <S%H3828><s%> with all spices <S%H81><s%> of the merchant? <S%H7402><s%>
Behold, <S%H8010><s%> it is Solomon's carriage! <S%H4296><s%> Sixty <S%H8346><s%> mighty <S%H1368><s%> men are around <S%H5439><s%> it, <S%H1368><s%> of the mighty men of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

They all handle <S%H270><s%> the sword, <S%H2719><s%> and are expert <S%H3925><s%> in war. <S%H4421><s%> Every man <S%H376><s%> has his sword <S%H2719><s%> on his thigh, <S%H3409><s%> because of fear <S%H6343><s%> in the night. <S%H3915><s%>
King <S%H4428><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> himself a carriage <S%H668><s%> of the wood <S%H6086><s%> of Lebanon. <S%H3844><s%>

He made <S%H6213><s%> its pillars <S%H5982><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> its bottom <S%H7507><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> its seat <S%H4817><s%> of purple, <S%H713><s%> its midst <S%H8432><s%> being paved <S%H7528><s%> with love, <S%H160><s%> from the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

Go forth, <S%H3318><s%> you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Zion, <S%H6726><s%> and see <S%H7200><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> Solomon, <S%H8010><s%> with the crown <S%H5850><s%> with which his mother <S%H517><s%> has crowned <S%H5849><s%> him, <S%H3117><s%> in the day of his weddings, <S%H2861><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of the gladness <S%H8057><s%> of his heart. <S%H3820><s%> Lover
